TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to James F Perry, 12-13-1836

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., The Austin Papers, (Austin: University of Texas Press, 1927), 3 vols., Vol 3, pp. 476

div1.p: Mr. Hammeken wrote to me to buy him a horse— I have bought a mare that will suit him, for one hundred dollars— I expect him dayly—keep her untill he comes— I shall be down I expect tomorrow or next day
I think I will go to Brazoria a while to arrange land business— I can get no house here—
send me one hundred dollars to pay for the mare
Also send me two hundred dollars more making three hundred—
[Addressed:] Mr J. F. Perry Peach point
